hypothesis_content.title: Stress-to-Neutral Reversion via Extreme Fear Capitulation
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS regimes, when the Crypto Fear & Greed Index (or equivalent) hits ≤10 (Extreme Fear) and BTC's 24-hour price range exceeds 15% with a close near the day's low, a mean reversion long entry triggers on the first daily close above the prior day's high, anticipating transition to NEUTRAL.
hypothesis_content.rationale: STRESS regimes often end with capitulation events—extreme volatility combined with peak fear. A close above the prior day's high after such events suggests selling exhaustion and the first signs of stabilization, providing a favorable risk/reward for regime normalization plays.
entry_conditions: Close in bottom 30% of daily range
Next daily close > prior day's high

exit_conditions.take_profit: 10% gain from entry OR regime shifts to NEUTRAL (confidence > 55%)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: >35% of such signals lead to continued STRESS or transition directly to BEAR (failed stabilization).
